  • 18 AUGUST 2009

    Web Fonts

    We all know about the possibility to include fonts via CSS in our web site:

      @font-face {
    font-family: "Watusi";
    src: url("http://www.example.com/fonts/watusi.ttf");
    format("truetype");
  }

  h1 {
    font-family: "Watusi", sans-serif;
  }

    So, why don’t we use this technique ?

    There are a few reasons:

    • You may be violating your End User Licensing Agreement (EULA) with the font foundry.
    • No support for this technique in Internet Explorer.

    There is an workaround available for the Internet Explorer by Jon Tan. And there are Project on the way ( typekit , Typotheque ) to handle the license and technology problems for you. It’s just a matter of time when we can leave sIFR and Image Replacement technique’s behind us. Horay!

    Read the full featured blog post about this issue by Jeffrey Zeldman.

    Ressources:

    • Jeffrey Zeldman article about web fonts and standards
    • List of fonts available for @font-face embedding
    • making web fonts work in IE
    • introducing typekit
    • typotheque web font service preview
    • Sample by typotheque.
